definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

sentences.english: Folded in the card was a piece of paper.
sentences.chinese: 只见生日卡里夹着一张折叠起来的纸。

sentences.english: I sent her a birthday card, together with a bunch of flowers.
sentences.chinese: 我送了她一张生日卡，外加一束花。

sentences.english: Here he is, sending a birthday card to his ex-wife, yet now he’s with his former [FBI] colleague [Felicia Lang].
sentences.chinese: 他给前妻寄一张生日卡，和他以前的同事成了一对儿。

sentences.english: Everyone likes to get birthday cards .
sentences.chinese: 每个人都喜欢收到生日卡。

sentences.english: Learn how to make a creative pop-up birthday card from scratch in this free video.
sentences.chinese: 了解如何在这免费视频创意弹出从头生日卡。

sentences.english: Finish the birthday card for one of the birthday people.
sentences.chinese: 写张生日卡给其中一个生日的人。

sentences.english: He selected an appropriate birthday card for his mother.
sentences.chinese: 他给母亲精心挑选了一张合适的生日卡。

sentences.english: Attached to it was a birthday card.
sentences.chinese: 附在上面的是一张生日卡。

sentences.english: I like birthday cards and birthday candles .
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢生日卡和生日蜡烛。

sentences.english: I can buy a birthday card for her.
sentences.chinese: 我可以给她买一个生日卡。

sentences.english: It's a birthday card for you.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你给我寄来的生日卡。
